Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So the process starts with receiving a customer request which is Task A

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then theres a XOR gateway to check the request type If its standard they go through Task B1 which is standard validation If its custom they go to Task B2 which is a feasibility analysis

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For the standard path after B1 theres an AND gateway for parallel checks credit check C1 and inventory check C2 Both need to complete before moving on to calculate the delivery date in Task D

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then after that theres another XOR gateway to check if approval is needed

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If yes they go through Task F to get manager approval Then another XOR gateway checks if approval is granted If yes generate the invoice Task G If not reevaluate conditions Task H and loop back to either D for standard or E1 for custom

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Wait but how does it know where to loop back Maybe thats based on the original path taken

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: On the custom path after B2 theres a XOR gateway to check feasibility If yes prepare a custom quotation E1 if no send rejection E2 and end

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: But if E1 is done then they proceed to the same approval gateway as the standard path So after E1 or D they reach the approval gateway

Name: Validation - PE
Text: If approval is needed and granted they generate the invoice If not granted they loop back to either E1 or D That makes sense because if the custom quotation needs rework they go back to E1 For standard maybe after D if approval is denied they go back to D to recalculate

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then after generating the invoice Task G they send confirmation Task I and end Also if no approval is needed they skip the approval steps and go directly to Task G

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the main differences between standard and custom are the initial validation steps and the feasibility check for custom

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Approvals are triggered based on some condition maybe the request type or the result of the validation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If approval is denied they loop back to adjust either the custom quotation or the delivery date calculation

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The key points are the XOR decisions parallel tasks for standard and the approval loop

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Mention that after standard or custom paths complete they converge at the approval gateway The loop can send them back to different tasks depending on the original path which maintains process integrity

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Tasks differ in that B1 is standard checks while B2 assesses custom feasibility The approval steps ensure that certain decisions require higher authority and rework steps prevent process failure by allowing adjustments
